  • Method Details

    • run

      public static void run(Runnable fn)
      Start 'fn' in thread apart.

      Example: 

          Thr.run(() -> Task.process());
      Parameters:
      fn - Action to run.

    • run

      public static void run(Runnable fn, long millis, Runnable onInterrupt)
      Start 'fn' in thread apart, waiting at most 'millis' milliseconds. After this time the thread will be interrupted and 'onInterrupt' executed.

      Example: 

          Thr.run(
      () -> Task.process(),
      2000,
      () -> System.out.println("LOG--0")
    );
      Parameters:
      fn - Action to run.
      millis - Milliseconds for wait.
      onInterrupt - Action if the thread is interrupted.

    • start

      public static Thread start(Runnable fn)
      Start 'fn' in thread apart and returns its identifier to use with '.join'.

      Example: 

          Thread th = Thr.start(() -> Task.process());
    ...
    th.join();
    ...
      Parameters:
      fn - Action to run.
      Returns:
      The Thread created.

    • start

      public static Thread start(Runnable fn, long millis, Runnable onInterrupt)
      Start 'fn' in thread apart, waiting at most 'millis' milliseconds. After this time the thread will be interrupted and 'onInterrupt' executed.

      'start' returns the thread identifier to use with 'join'.

      Example: 

          Thread th = Thr.start(
      () -> Task.process(),
      2000,
      () -> System.out.println("LOG--0")
    );
    ...
    th.join();
    ...
      Parameters:
      fn - Action to run.
      millis - Milliseconds for wait.
      onInterrupt - Action if the thread is interrupted.
      Returns:
      The Thread created.

    • sync

      public static void sync(Runnable fn)
      Synchronizes 'fn'.

      'fn' must not call another function that calls 'sync' directly or indirectly.

      Parameters:
      fn - Function to synchronize.
